job_title: Exec. Dir. of Strategic Initiatives in Clinton, SC
pros: The best part of working at PC is our people--students, faculty, staff. Everyone is dedicated to doing their best to support our students; we truly care about each other. It's not "just a job" for anyone.
cons: Because of the dedication of our employees, the workload can be challenging at times.

pros: I enjoyed working with Drew. PC fostered a good environment.
cons: Salary was not comparative to other areas. Paid much less.

pros:
Caring people
Small town feel
Making improvements
cons:
Pay
Small town feel can also be a con

job_title: Assistant Volleyball Coach in Clinton, SC
pros: Good place to start a career
cons: Low pay but you would know that going into it
Ridiculous pay for work. Too much politics. No one seems to be happy or cares about workers. Management is weak and in own little world clueless to realities.
Pay is not adequate for the work.

pros:
Flexibility
One on one interactions with students
Supportive Staff
cons: As a part time employee, my hours were usually evenings and unpredictable. I didn't enjoy the same benefits as if it were a full time position.

review_title: "Friendly people; but low, and I mean low salary"
job_title: Assistant Director of Residence Life in Clinton, SC
pros: Friendly faculty/staff; friendly students with manners; constant faculty/staff turnover (always someone new); pretty campus in the spring/summer; and a ton of PC grads working as faculty or staff.
cons: Small town (takes 30-45 mins to do anything worthwhile outside of the area); very low salary compared to other institutions; the area is not ideal for young professionals in many ways; many buildings need quite a number of updates.

review_title: A decent stepping stone, but not a place to grow
pros: Flexibility, generous vacation policy, coworkers, beautiful campus and great students.  Health insurance plan is very good.  The faculty is first rate.
cons: Low pay compared to similar institutions (well below average), little room for advancement/promotion at low staff level, the town offers few amenities or cultural outlets, the finances of the college appear unstable.

job_title: Mathematics and Physics Tutor in Clinton, SC
pros: Family environment, great people. Presbyterian College offers a great work environment with supportive people and intelligent students.
cons: I have no cons for Presbyterian College.

pros: Gained knowledge, skills, and experience that I would not gain in the classroom
cons: Sometimes hard to balance work/school life
Heavy teaching loads at times, not enough research support
